sen.j: 七五調（しちごちょう）とは詩で七音・五音の順番で繰り返す形式。
sen.e: Save-and-five syllable meter is a form of poem in which words of Shichion (seven syllables) and Goon (five syllables) repeat one after another.
Save-and-five syllable meter is a form of poem in which words of Shichion (seven syllables) and Goon (five syllables) repeat one after another.
Save-and-five syllable meter is a form of poem in which words of Shichion (seven syllables) and Goon (five syllables) repeat one after another.

sen.j: 五七調とは対照的に優しく優雅な感じを与えることを特徴とする。
sen.e: It gives gentle and elegant impression in contrast with five-and-seven syllable meter.
It gives gentle and elegant impression in contrast with five-and-seven syllable meter.
It gives gentle and elegant impression in contrast with five-and-seven syllable meter.

sen.j: 主に古今和歌集に使われている。
sen.e: This meter is mainly used in Kokin Wakashu' (A Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry).
This meter is mainly used in Kokin Wakashu (A Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry).
sen.cmt: 用語集の登録語句にもWakashu'とダッシュが入っていますが、不要と思われるため削除しました。
sen.e: This meter is mainly used in Kokin Wakashu (A Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry).

sen.j: 主な七五調の詩
sen.e: Main Poems in Seven-and-five Syllable Meter
Main Poems in Seven-and-five Syllable Meter
Main Poems in Seven-and-five Syllable Meter

sen.j: 与謝野晶子「君死にたまふ事なかれ」
sen.e: Akiko YOSANO "Kimi Shinitamokoto Nakare (Please Do Not Die)"
Akiko YOSANO "Kimi Shinitamou koto nakare (Thou Shalt Not Die)"
sen.cmt: 「君死にたまふ事なかれ」用語集に登録があったので登録語句を反映しました。
sen.e: Akiko YOSANO 'Kimi Shinitamou koto nakare' (Thou Shalt Not Die)

sen.j: いろは歌
sen.e: The Iroha (a Japanese poem, probably written sometime during the Heian era)
The Iroha (a Japanese poem, probably written sometime during the Heian era)
The Iroha (a Japanese poem, probably written sometime during the Heian era)

sen.j: 明治時代の文明開化以降に作られた唱歌や寮歌、軍歌を中心に見られる。
sen.e: This meter is seen mainly in Shoka, Ryoka, and Gunka (songs) which were made after civilization and enlightenment in Meiji Period.
This meter is seen mainly in Shoka, Ryoka, and Gunka (songs) which were made after civilization and enlightenment in Meiji Period.
This meter is seen mainly in Shoka, Ryoka, and Gunka (songs) which were made after civilization and enlightenment in Meiji Period.

sen.j: 現在でも校歌に七五調を採用する学校は多い。
sen.e: There are many schools today which use this meter for their establishment of the school song.
There are many schools today which use this meter for their establishment of the school song.
There are many schools today which use this meter for their establishment of the school song.

sen.j: 七五調の歌詞を持つ歌は、同じ七五調の別の曲の節で歌っても歌唱上は違和感がない。
sen.e: Songs with words in seven-and-five syllable meter can be sung in the melody of other song in this meter without uncomfortable feeling as a song.
Songs with words in seven-and-five syllable meter can be sung in the melody of other song in this meter without uncomfortable feeling as a song.
Songs with words in seven-and-five syllable meter can be sung in the melody of other song in this meter without uncomfortable feeling as a song.

sen.j: 概ね互換性があるといえる。
sen.e: It may be said to have interchangeability with each other in general.
It may be said to have interchangeability with each other in general.
It may be said to have interchangeability with each other in general.
